Pass It On implements the dice used in the game Never Say Die, published by Philips in 1959.

Each player starts with 3 chips. On a player's turn, they roll as many dice as they have chips (maximum 3 dice), and does the following for each die:

For an arrow pointing either left or right, the player passes a chip to the player on his left or right, respectively.

For an arrow pointing up, the player puts a chip in the center pot.

For a white dot, the player does nothing.

The player who puts the last chip into the center pot is the winner.

This rolls many dice simultaneously, useful for games that have dice pools like Arkham Horror or many RPGs from White Wolf.

To use, select a number and type of dice to be rolled, then set the threshold values for successes and failures.

Any result less than or equal to the value in the Failure field will be counted as a failure, and any result greater than or equal to the value in the Success field will be counted as a success.

To disable either one, enter 0 in the appropriate field.
This is a useful tool for rolling a character\'s starting ability scores in d20-based RPGs. To use, choose the appropriate method of calculation, then press the Roll button.

This is a polyhedral dice roller. When the Roll button is pressed, the total calculated using the formula

AdB + C * D

where A is the number of dice rolled and B are the number of sides on each die.

C will be added to the result before being multiplied by D.
